alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 2:51AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following county, Blaine. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 AM MDT, emergency management reported that heavy rain in the advisory area from thunderstorms yesterday had caused rapid river and creek rises. This was confirmed by river gauge reports. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinook, Harlem, Fort Belknap, Hays, Turner, Zurich, Cleveland, Lloyd, Lohman, Hogeland and Lodge Pole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
